page.title: 121 km2 Wild Flowers Tongue
page.content: 'One day at the beginning of June we went out to see how many different wild flowers we could find in the square 02590956, that's the square the school is in. We searched along the burnside and then we went on to the road and looked at the verges of the road. Altogether we found 26 differ ent kinds and we brought them back in to school and mounted them on card for a display. They were:- marsh marigold, mint, lady's smock, marsh dandelion, blue & yellow forget-me-not, daisy, St John's wort,fern, bush vetch, bitt er vetch, tufted vetch, bird's foot trefoil, bracken, narrow-leaved plant ain, earth-nut, bog cotton, butter burr, dog-violet, mouse-eared chick weed, speedwell, milkwort, lousewort, broom, tormentil, yellow pimpernel, foxglove. The flowers were later in blooming this year, the cold spring.
